title.narrative: GIRLS AND BOYS AND THEIR FAMILY EMPOWERED TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO VIOLENCE

description.narrative: All girls and boys and their families are empowered to prevent and respond to violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 all girls and boys, including adolescents in all settings, are protected from violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: All girls and boys and their families are empowered to prevent and respond to violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation.

description.narrative: In early 2020, the draft Communication for Development (C4D) and Child Protection strategy was finalized in order to guide programming around norms change on violence and disabilities and increasing access to services. At the onset of COVID-19, UNICEF provided technical support to the Government of Rwanda to develop and disseminate messages around the risks of violence during COVID-19 lockdown, online child protection risks, and the risks of infection for particularly vulnerable children. COVID-19 prevention information was also disseminated to 36 institutions in Rwanda, including 18 rehabilitation centres for street children and six detention centres housing children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020
